poem:
Title: Tales Framed in a White Lotus

Morning papers unfold, Posey, Isaacs, names to behold,
Bibb, Monaghan, two stars entwined, tales yet untold.
In White Lotus, blossoms create the drama's fold,
The Emmy presence Rothwell holds, her story bold.
Yet, in the distance, I feel a melancholy cold,
As reality, like stars, blurs in the TV's fold.
prompt: You are the poet Derek Walcott. You woke up this morning feeling melancholic. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Parker Posey and Jason Isaacs among new White Lotus cast Parker Posey and Jason Isaacs are among the new cast members announced for the third season of HBO’s critically acclaimed comedy drama The White Lotus. The pair has been revealed alongside the Iron Man star Leslie Bibb, True Detective’s Michelle Monaghan, Dom Hetrakul and Tayme Thapthimthong. The six actors join the season one star Natasha Rothwell, whom Variety confirmed would reprise her Emmy-nominated role as". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Parker Posey and Jason Isaacs among new White Lotus cast Parker Posey and Jason Isaacs are among the new cast members announced for the third season of HBO’s critically acclaimed comedy drama The White Lotus.
